subject: Re: [junit] Re: JUnit 4.x and support for Java 1.4
msgSnippet: ... I m interested in tackling the problem if it isn t too large. I need to ask corporate permission to contribute back to the community. Nuttsss!! Questions
messageBody:
> It makes sense to want to use declarative tests with Java 1.4. I find that
> JUnit 4 tests read better than those written with earlier versions.
> However,
> we have no plans to backport the annotation-style tests to earlier
> versions
> of Java. I'm not philosophically opposed to the idea, it just isn't a
> priority. If someone wants to jump in on the engineering, we're open to
> discussing what could be done.


I'm interested in tackling the problem if it isn't too large. I need to ask
corporate permission to contribute back to the community. Nuttsss!!

Questions
1) Aside from annotations is there anything else that you think is tied to
Java 1.4?
2) If I do this work can it get rolled into the mainstream? Or will I have
to maintain it backporting other changes in Junit 4.x?

Thanks for your help
Mark
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Blog: http://www.notesfromatooluser.com/


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
